3: Affiliation unknown, and there are no bionic machines infected with the virus in the group. Has the route alliance been fighting them?
From our observations over our visit, this does seem to be the case. This is something that only happens in this polar region.
The numbers on the report shouldn't have any mistakes, right?
On the snow, a group of Constructs and a Commandant discuss the current situation.
The Commandant, who doesn't look in good shape, leans on a tree in the middle of the discussion to make it more comfortable. The Construct also express concern for his physical condition.
Commandant Simon, should we head back to the alliance Stronghold first?
I have a little OCD, so I will be even more uncomfortable if I don't sort out the current problems.
And so he sits on the ground and picks up a fallen branch to make a map in the snow.
This route is not under attack by unknown bionic machines. Their defense is insufficient, so they have asked Babylonia to lend support.
And the higher ups have decided to divide the support in two stages. The first stage would be done by us, land forces that can be deployed immediately.
The second stage will be done by the support sent from Babylonia, led by one of the Forest Guard and named Rosetta.
So the support should be arriving in a few days, right?
Yes. We can start various operations when they do, like driving off the bionic machines and taking back the occupied alliance ship route area...
I hear the support troops will also have their Commandant.
Atiel... Where did you run off to?
A Construct runs out of the forest, interrupting Simon's thoughts. The marks on her body show that she has been fighting something up to a moment ago.
Can't you listen to commands? You're always running around... I've stressed how important teamwork is, right?
What I do is also beneficial to the battle. But I wonder how our ragtag team is going to match up with the Commandant the higher-ups sent.
It's true that we're temporary troops transferred from various teams, but can't you put it more nicely?
Haha, sorry.
Including me, all of them were temporarily transferred... The main fighting force can only look to HQ.
Simon, your face is all tensed up again. Relax!
So saying, Atiel slaps Simon hard on the back again. She means well and to encourage a comrade, but it is like a huge blow to Simon.
Ah... Argh...
You start throwing up as expected... I'll bury it in the snow later.
While Simon is still in pain, a message is suddenly transmitted from Babylonia.
—【kuroname】.
Ahem... I see. Get the representative here... Ugh.
Talking as you throw up? You're pushing yourself too hard, Simon.
